answers.answer: I am not clear exactly what you are asking from your question heading and the body of your question. A routine diabetic test is the Glucose tolerance test. It is a 2-3hr test to determine if you have diabetes. If you need more blood work, request a full panel so that all levels are visible, such as thyroid, liver, etc. and the Doctor is able to determine if there is anything has decreased or normal.

question: one test came back positive IgG at 80 other antibody test negative. Should other tests be done for a full immunilogical assessment? Should spleen, thyroid, tb, tests be done? Are there cases where it is a false positive?
title: diabetes tests
